recent.text:
I learned a lot at @jamstackconf and the @freeCodeCamp #JAMstack hackathon... not least of which being that @freeCodeCamp has this excellent non-stop music to code-by channel on @YouTube

https://t.co/vjfgKy5MH6

The #jamstack hackathon with @freeCodeCamp had many highlights for me. But getting the chance to speak to the teams, hear what they are making, and how they came together to share their knowledge and the experience was particularly delightful. https://t.co/IfUsgweJEy
Fixing to horribly fail the @jaffathecake friendship test. https://t.co/sHOTVea2FQ
Standing room only at @github for the @freeCodeCamp #JAMstack hackathon. With oodles more working remotely and watching the livestream. https://t.co/x3p8Rnj9fu
Watching @ossia call time on breakfast, and get ready to start the @freeCodeCamp #JAMstack hackathon at @github. https://t.co/BhE64vyH82
Prepping to introduce the #JAMstack hackathon  at @github with FreeCodeCamp https://t.co/tHJHNr1wTf https://t.co/47ufpxsYYd

The goals of @snyksec for a safer web are superb.
The people there are wonderful.
They are hiring.

Just sayin'!

https://t.co/i6JntP3gck
These sketchnotes are outrageously beautiful! https://t.co/kACLD1Lwkl
Banners https://t.co/B8u6nXoNzW https://t.co/Lw3B0Vm3EO
Game night. https://t.co/guNlMpmXAH https://t.co/XzC4wI7IFi
Found him. https://t.co/74HecEETzG https://t.co/Tj7m4xFQSQ

Just watching Klay warm up. üò≤
No headband. No problem. https://t.co/AYdoQJap5q https://t.co/RREw6YG160
Word. https://t.co/6p3DWAEFv9

I don't think I could have loved @jamstackconf more!

All speakers were incredible!
The atmosphere was wonderful.
The attendees were friendly, inquisitive & engaged.

From start to finish, it was a joy. Thanks for making MC-ing such a treat, people of #JAMstack Conf!

YES! @syntaxfm is happening LIVE at @jamstackconf. Yay to @wesbos and @stolinski

ü§©ü§©ü§©ü§© https://t.co/PJVMo8VbFM

"When I realized what an impact learning to code could have, I wanted to help as many people learn to code as possible."

‚Äî Says @ossia, founder of @freeCodeCamp at @jamstackconf in his talk, How https://t.co/YQI6SoDCpU serves millions of learners using the #JAMstack

"The beauty of #GraphQL is that we know exactly what response to expect from any request we are making"

‚Äî @simona_cotin has a wonderful gift for making complex concepts simple.

#JAMstack Conf https://t.co/ksnOTiGHE6
Bracing for incoming comments to moderate as @chriscoyier mentions https://t.co/5ORKjiZtLB, an example of comments in a pregenerated, #jamstack site at @jamstackconf

"I'm a front end developer and I don't need anybody...!"

‚Äî @chriscoyier is feeling empowered (and full of beans at @jamstackconf) https://t.co/PEUVdgbxwc

"Tabletop.js gives you the data from Google Sheets that you would have expected from the Google API"

‚Äî Top tip from @jllord at @jamstackconf

Sold!

"I wanted to make the documentation part of the product repo"

‚Äî @jllord being utterly brilliant at @jamstackconf, talking about how Electron gained momentum thanks to standardizing and unifying its styleguide and docs with @jekyllrb https://t.co/hoVhhnblIa

"The users only care about the pixels, they don't give a shit about your hardships with your infrastructure"

‚Äî Truth from @notwaldorf at @jamstackconf

üòç

Oh wow. The energy, smarts, and enthusiasm of @notwaldorf is utterly infectious.

Brilliant at @jamstackconf https://t.co/Wi5SYeses1

Fascinating to see @biilmann share data from @Netlify about the various popularity of different frameworks, tools and site generators being used in deployments in the exponentially growing @Netlify build stats.

#JAMstack Conf https://t.co/G7lO3ER5Hl

"How might we use the existing git workflows as the basis for a complete web development workflow?"

‚Äî @biilmann reflects on the thinking behind the developer experience on @Netlify at #jamstack conf.

Keynote address at @jamstackconf from @biilmann. Excited for demos and a peep into both past and also the future.

Always brilliant to watch.
#JAMstack https://t.co/Eb5MuqBuS7
